body.raw:
For a long time I've wanted to build something that allows me to track my outdoor activities - specifically my longer rucks in preparation for trips later this year.
I'd never worked with Mapbox, (specifically @rnmapbox/maps) or even React Native at this point. It was a good opportunity to start something new, given I've spent a decent amount of time with React and its metaframeworks.
Terratrack is very minimal. You select your activity type, record your activity and save it to your device. There's an elevation chart for good measure. You can skribble along the chart and see your marker on the selected activity, which I think is pretty cool and useful feature.

You can also create an account (secured by Clerk) and upload your activites to the cloud. These are stored on Supabase and secured with Supabase Auth too. Thats because theres a web app that allows you to login, and view your uploaded activities. It's a lot easier and more pleasing to view your gps tracks on a bigger screen.
The main issue you'll run into is using rnmapbox/maps camera functionality. You can use Mapbox UserLocation component to get consistent location updates - this works fine on IOS, but on Android this is an issue... ``` { // update your state }} /> ```
This is a problem with certain Android devices due to the OS killing the app either through battery and power management. There are two ways to solve this problem - Running a task manager and asking the user to disable battery optimization for the app.{" "}
